newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia MP Short in share conflict - Oppn.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia MP Short in share conflict - Oppn.

text.p: Australian Opposition Finance spokesman Nick Sherry said on Thursday Assistant Treasurer Jim Short had a direct conflict of interest by owning shares in ANZ and other major companies.
"He's (Short) involved in decision-making in the Expenditure Review Committee, cabinet meetings, and he sees briefs from Treasury and Finance," Sherry told reporters.
"He's had a massive conflict of interest," Sherry said.
"In respect to ANZ shares, Short is directly involved in Retirement Savings Accounts policy and development of superannuation decisions which affects the value of ANZ."
Short could now profit from the sale of those shares and should resign, he said.
He should have sold them six months ago when he took up his ministerial post, he said.
"He has a direct conflict with the prime minister's own ministerial guidelines that require him to sell those shares when he became a minister."
